content.title: FIRST SETUP
content.body:
You descend into darkness.

The carved stone architecture cools the air and turns the path into a true journey through the past. It definitely smells that way. Humans built Blackriver, but not this place. It is far too old. Far too well built.

The stairs end in another hall where the Darkness clings to the walls. Weak, but present. You exchange glances. The Undead King’s resurrections did not come cheap, and it’s impossible not to feel a flicker of hope.

Hope for what, exactly?

Your efforts here have long surpassed what was agreed upon in your contract, and chances are there will be no payment at all. Why should you stay even a minute longer on this fool’s errand? Those who hired you are probably all dead by now.

In truth, it doesn’t matter. Whether for professionalism, devotion to a greater cause, or a sheer thirst for vengeance, turning back is not an option. You either defeat the Darkness or it defeats you.

There is no middle ground…
content.instruction:
SCENARIO OBJECTIVE – DUNGEON CRAWL
To complete this Adventure, you must advance through all the rooms, defeating every enemy along the way until you find the Adventure End Trigger.
GAME MECHANIC – GROWING DARKNESS
Darkness lurks in the shadows, but it lacks the strength to manifest. Place the Growing Darkness Rune card with face A up in the Rune Slot at the bottom end of the Initiative Track.
SCENARIO MONSTERS
This dungeon is filled with unusual Monsters. For this Setup, place the Crypt Guardian Scenario Monster card in the appropriate slot of the Initiative Track and use Executioner models to represent them on the board.

content.title: DUNGEON FOYER
content.body:
The first door leads you into an abandoned antechamber where the smell of death and mold spreads like smoke.

This hall was sealed, but not uninhabited. Not for a long time.

Black vines cling to the walls, and the sinister energy of the Darkness pulses ever stronger. The source of this infestation is not far, but at least here the black mass is not yet strong enough to manifest.

How long has this place been nurturing the enemy?

Could the corruption take root so deeply in just a matter of weeks?
content.instruction:
SPECIAL MECHANICS – FATAL PUSH
When a Monster standing on one of the squares of Bridge BR1-B is targeted by a PUSH or TELEKINESIS effect, the Hero casting it may choose to throw that Monster off the Bridge, killing it.

content.title: QUEEN'S HALL
content.body:
The hall that receives you is as vast as it is intriguing.

At its center, facing a statue made of plate armor, a metallic cube floats five feet off the ground.

Invisible shockwaves emanate from it. The cadence of the pulses—felt in your very bones—resembles that of a heartbeat.

The Darkness amassed in the corners of the room trembles with each pulse, ready to strike.
content.instruction:
SETUP 2
Prepare the Setup for this room.
HERO PROGRESSION
Each Hero learns a Hero Skill.
SCENE TRIGGER
If the Companion Matthias Cormack has joined the Party, read the scene "Shadows of the Past".
GAME MECHANICS – DARKNESS NODES
Until the end of the Adventure, whenever a Setup indicates a Pile of Runes, form it by taking 1 Rune of each color from the Initiative Track.
GAME MECHANICS – TIE BREAKER
As a Minor Action, a Hero adjacent to a Darkness Node may take Runes equal to 6 minus the number of Heroes in the Party and return them to the bag. When they do, they gain FOCUS 1 or CLEANSE 1.

content.title: THE FORGE
content.body:
The door reveals a forge.

It’s easy to recognize the traits of Dwarven architecture: the massive size, the design full of straight lines and sharp angles, the thick black coal dust…

You can almost hear the songs of the smiths who once worked here. Were it another time, you would have set up camp and shared crackling pork and stout beer with all those imagined people, learning the stories that were never told.

But reality steals the daydream like a punch to the face.

This hall has new masters now…
content.instruction:
SETUP – REFURBISH
The Bridge BR1-B must be removed from Maps DNB8-F and DNB9-F. Until the end of this Adventure, no Character or Object may occupy any Maps prior to Door 02. You may remove all Setups before Door 2 to save space, if desired.
GAME MECHANICS – MONSTER RAID
Place the Monster Raid Game Mechanic card at the top end of the Initiative Track, above the Rune card slot, with face 'A' up and the 'Accursed' Minion Monster card in its proper position there. Set aside the 4 Night Predator models.

content.title: ARTISAN'S GALLERY
content.body:
Alcoves, statues, and altars fill this crypt.

The place is both a tomb and a museum, built to remember those who fell so future generations could walk—the heroes of the Shadow War.

Statues of Elves and Draconians guard carvings of a dozen noble crests, symbols once borne on the banners of each Elven host—symbols that even lords of death feared.

One wonders: how could the stoic philosophy of the Doctrine have descended from such ruthless warriors?
content.instruction:
HERO PROGRESSION
Each Hero learns a Class Ability.
GAME MECHANICS – DARKNESS HUNTING
Replace the 'Growing Darkness' Rune card on the Initiative Track with the 'Darkness Hunting' card, with the same side up. Until the end of this Adventure, the 'Darkness Hunting' Game Mechanic will be in effect. The Darkness follows the Standard Darkness Behavior.

content.title: PROVING GROUNDS
content.body:
Dust spreads everywhere as two great courtyards lie carved into the raw earth like arenas.

Slightly rotted planks shaped like swords end the mystery: this is a training field.

The murals depict athletic Elves in striking poses, facing off against each other, while Draconians observe from a distance and other figures hold equipment as if they were squires.

Perhaps… Humans?

One might think so, but the Exiles from Old Amira—the first of them to arrive—came centuries after the Shadow War, didn’t they?
content.instruction:
SETUP – REFURBISH
The Bridge BR1-B introduced by this Setup must be removed from Maps E11-F and DNC9-F, which were assembled through Doors 02 and 03.
GAME MECHANICS – RAID ENDED
Remove the Monster Raid Game Mechanic card and the Accursed Minion Monster card from the Initiative Track. From now on, the Monster Raid Game Mechanic is no longer in effect.
GAME MECHANICS – REACTIVE STANCE
Draw 1 Commander Attack Card for each Hero in the Party and position them on the Initiative Track in the appropriate slots.

content.title: MAIN HALL
content.body:
The path returns to the beginning, but something is off.

The metallic cube trembles frantically in the air, shaking so wildly that the sound reaching your ears resembles the buzz of a thousand bees. Clearly, this disturbing symphony isn’t meant for you. The murderous mass dances across the walls, stretching and shrinking like dough being kneaded by a baker.

You don’t need to be a genius to know what’s coming next…
content.instruction:
HERO PROGRESSION
Each Hero learns a Hero Skill.
SCENE TRIGGER
When this Door is opened, after completing its Setup, read 'Scene – Back to Square One'

content.title: FIRST SETUP
content.body:
You couldn't have been left in a more alien place.

Silence reigns. The ground is so cold it seems never to have been kissed by the Sun, and there's not even the sound of running water or howling winds. Life does not belong in this place. Even the air is missing when you draw it into your lungs.

And yet, this place was once inhabited. The stone floor slabs are too perfectly fitted. Another fortress. Or rather, a mausoleum carrying memories of those who fell in silence. The first victims? Could this be the gift brought by the great utopia of Unlife that the Undead King speaks of? A world with no need or desire…

A world without a soul.

There is no sign of the vortex that brought you here, but everything that goes around comes around, right? Perhaps the answer is still lost nearby, untouched thanks to the same stoic nature that makes everything feel so unnatural.

Standing still won't bring answers.
content.instruction:
SCENARIO OBJECTIVE – MIXED SCENARIO
This Adventure is divided into 3 parts. The first is the Dungeon Crawl. To complete it, move through all rooms defeating all enemies along the way until you find the clues that lead you to the next stage of the Adventure. Ideally, each game session covers one Stage.
GAME MECHANICS – DARKNESS NODES / TIE BREAKER
The Darkness has condensed into nodes. Until the end of the Adventure, whenever a Setup indicates a Pile of Runes, form it by taking 1 Rune of each color from the Initiative Track. As a Cube Action, a Hero adjacent to a Darkness Node may discard 1 AC to take Runes equal to 6 minus the number of Heroes in the Party and return them to the bag. When they do, they gain FOCUS 1 or CLEANSE 1.
GAME MECHANIC – INVESTIGATION JOB
Take the 8 Journal cards, shuffle them, and place them face down as a deck. During this Adventure, when a Hero loots a Chest, they also draw a Journal card for the Party. These cards should not be stored in the Bags. They are shared among the Party. Set them aside and keep them near the play area.

content.title: DRACONIC CHAPEL
content.body:
Four Draconic statues adorn this hall, which strongly resembles the chancel of a Church of the Setting Sun. This is no coincidence—the High Dragons colonized Drunagor nearly a millennium and a half ago.

Were they religious? And what about the Elves, the authors of the Doctrine?

Speculative scholars ponder the nature of the relationship between these species, intrigued by the disappearance of the Dragons from ecclesiastical records following the arrival of the Amiran Exiles—the Humans.

Do men truly know which gods they pray to?
content.instruction:
HERO PROGRESSION
Each Hero learns a Class Ability.
GAME MECHANICS – GEM HUNT
The Chests in this Setup offer additional rewards. Take the 3 Dragon Gem Adventure Item cards and keep them nearby. When a Chest from this Setup is looted, the Hero draws 1 of these cards along with a Chest Item and a Journal card. Gems are not stored in the Hero’s bag. They are shared among the Party. Set them aside and keep them near the play area.
GAME MECHANIC – WORMHOLES
Traveling through the fortress is easier than you thought. Heroes may use Time tokens as alternative pathways across the board. When they step onto one of these tokens, they may reposition their model on any square of Map DNC7-B (center of the board). If they are moving, they may then continue their movement from their new position. Time tokens are Immovable Ground Objects.
SPECIAL RULE – LOCKED DOOR
Door 03 is locked until instructed otherwise.

content.title: CRYPTS
content.body:
Statues of warriors guard altars and sarcophagi. Here, the valor of those “who fell when the hour was most dire” is exalted and eternalized.

Just ahead, massive pots, casks, and shattered barrels spill centuries-old grain across the floor—a brewery, here.

That might raise some eyebrows, but the truth is that even the smallest parishes in Daren usually have one. A tradition—perhaps you've just discovered its origin.

Could alcohol, the serum of truth, reveal the secrets of this place?
content.instruction:
HERO PROGRESSION
Each Hero learns a Class Ability.
GAME MECHANIC – WORMHOLES
Traveling through the fortress is easier than you thought. Heroes may use Time tokens as alternative pathways across the board. When they step onto one of these tokens, they may reposition their model onto any square of Map DNC7-B (center of the board). If they are moving, they may then continue their movement from their new position. Time tokens are Immovable Ground Objects.
SPECIAL RULE – LOCKED DOOR
Door 04 is locked until instructed otherwise.

content.title: LIBRARY
content.body:
The sterility of this place has been kind to the library.

Shelves, tables, and tomes that would have perished if exposed to the elements are preserved as if someone had just used them. Darkness has no hunger for inanimate matter.

The High Dragons could take on humanoid forms, which might explain why all the furnishings here are scaled to your size—or almost. The ceilings are three or four times taller than normal.

It’s time to start looking for some answers…
content.instruction:
GAME MECHANIC – WARP
The magic that spawns creatures in this place also helps Heroes move more quickly through the fortress. From now on, as a Move Action, Heroes may suffer CURSE 1 to teleport to a square adjacent to any Time token anywhere on the board. This Game Mechanic does not affect the Wormholes.

content.title: LABORATORY
content.body:
The correlation between Darkness and Alchemy is undeniable. Every fortress that has fallen harbored a well-equipped laboratory.

The Drunagorians have yet to unravel the symbiosis between these forces, but one thing is increasingly clear: before becoming a necrotic force, the murderous mass was an alchemical product—magical and revolutionary like no other.

Perhaps it’s no coincidence that apocalyptic tales always foretell the end of the world when science and greed are wed…
